title: Lauren_Mills published Mattioli Woods launches new fund
text:
Comments (0) 
A wealth management and employee benefits business is poised to launch a new product to improve returns for investors. 
Mattioli Woods, based in Grove Park, Enderby, will unveil its structured products fund later this month in a move it claims is "hugely significant" for the financial services sector. 
It builds on Mattioli Woods' long-standing track record, managing more than Â£100 million in structured investments which have provided average annual returns of more than six per cent. 
The firm said its new approach will make it as easy for clients to buy and sell structured products as ordinary shares. 
Read more: Growth up a quarter at wealth management firm Mattioli Woods 
In a statement, Mattioli Woods said the assets of its new fund will be secured by Government bonds. Previously, investors were exposed to the bank providing the structured product, so if the bank went bust, all the investor's money could be lost. 
Mattioli Woods' new fund will also be continuously available, in contrast to other structured products which can only be bought during a specified sales period. 
Read more: Mattioli Woods boss says UK economy is robust enough for Brexit to happen 
The publicly quoted company said the new fund offers "immediate access to a diversified portfolio of structured products" adding that in the past, the same portfolio would have taken more than a year to put together. 
Chief executive Ian Mattioli, said: "It is a major step forward for us in achieving a better solution at a cheaper cost for our clients, which in turn improves the prospective return. 
"The fund reduces costs by charging less than individual plans have done historically. We believe cost savings to clients will be significant." 
The new fund will be rolled out on November 28, in association with Commerzbank, after being recognised by the UK's financial regulator, the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA).
